thesis.description: The culture filtrates of Lancefield group A, Griffith type 12 nephritogenic streptococci have been shown by Reed and Matheson (1954) to produce renal lesions, urinary abnormalities, and sustalned hypertension in rabbits. The nephrotoxic substance is dialysable and can be salted out from the concentrated dialysate at 60-75% of full saturation with ammonium sulfate. Matheson (1957) has shown that this fraction contains a mixture of polypeptides which are nephrotoxic in rabbits and Rhesus monkeys (Reed and Matheson 1960). The polypeptides have been separated electrophoretically and Cheuk (1960) has found that one polypeptide band contains more nephrotoxic activity than the other observable bands. [...]
thesis.creator: Franklin, Maxine A.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology & Immunology.
thesis.title: The biological detection of streptococcal nephrotoxin.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The present (research) report is concerned with communication patterns of lower socio-economic groups and is based upon a systematic review of professional literature. The study focuses on the modes, or styles, or patterns of lower-class clients' communication. [...]
thesis.creator: Frank, Karen.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Communication with the lower-class.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this paper is two fold. Firstly, to introduce and study the Silov Boundary of a Banach algebra of continuous complex valued functions defined on a compact Hausdorff space X. Secondly, to apply the definition of Silov Boundary to more general families of functions, namely, to linear spaces and semi-groups of functions. It will be seen that in these latter cases, existence of the Silov Boundary depends on certain restricting assumptions about the linear space or semi-group. [...]
thesis.creator: Fox, Abraham S.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
Aggregates.
Banach spaces.
thesis.title: The Silov boundary.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Certaines observations suggèrent une influence de la vallée du Saint-Laurent sur la distribution des averses à sa surface. D'autre part, depuis quelques années, les membres du "'Stormy Weather Group" ont enregistré sur films de 35-mm les échos apparaissant sur un écran de radar doté d'un indicateur panoramique à altitude constanto (IPAC). L'utilisation de ces films permet à l'auteur d'approfondir le sujet par l'identification des premiers échos et le tracé de leur trajectoire subséquente. Des dossiers, établis pour 76 premiers échos, relient ceux-ci à la surface et au profil du terrain. [...]
thesis.creator: Fortin, J. P. (Jean Pierre).
thesis.subject: Rain and rainfall.
Meteorology.
Meteorology -- Saint Lawrence River Valley.
Radar meteorology.
thesis.title: Topographie et précipitation dans la vallée du Saint-Laurent.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In June, 1959, I entered into a contract with the United States Atomic Energy Commission (Contract No. AT(04-3-315) to direct a programme of human geographical studies in Northwestern Arctic Alaska. These studies were part of the bio-environmental programme for Project Chariot. They were centred on the Eskimo village of Point Hope but included the villages of Noatak and Point Lay. Although the contract terminated on June 1st, 1961 I remained in arctic Alaska for an additiona1 year of research. [...]
thesis.creator: Foote, Don Charles.
thesis.subject: Arctic regions -- Discovery and exploration.
Alaska -- Discovery and exploration.
Geography.
thesis.title: Exploration and resource utilization in northwestern Arctic Alaska before 1855.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Hermodice carunculata (Pallas) is an Amphinomid po1ychaete commonly found throughout the Caribbean area (Marsden, 1960). It also occurs in the Gulf of Mexico (Hartman, 1951) and off the coast of southern Florida (Mullin, 1923). The family Amphinomidae includes the first species of annelids to be described from the Western Hemisphere. In the eighteenth century, some West Indian faunal collections were deposited in various museums of western Europe. At that time, a young physician, Peter Simon Pallas, became interested in these collections. [...]
thesis.creator: Fitzsimons, Patricia Gail.
thesis.subject: Annelida -- Anatomy.
Polychaeta -- Anatomy.
Zoology.
thesis.title: The anatomy and neurosecretory system of the supraoesophageal ganglion of Hermodice Carunculata (Annelida: Polychaeta).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: While the cyclohexane ring can exist in chair and boat conformations, at room temperature no pure conformation can be isolated. However, it is believed that the chair form is predominant (1). When two chair conformations are possible the equatorially substituted conformation is thermodynamically more stable than the axially substituted one (2). [...]
thesis.creator: Ferland, Jean-Marie.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Stereochemistry of some oxygen heterocycles.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The cross sections of elastically scattered 99 Mev protons have been measured absolutely to 3%. Detailed description of corrections applied to the cross sections are presented, including the measurement of the nuclear reactions in a NaI crystal due to protons incident at different energies. Work on the variables affecting a NaI counter resolution for high energy protons is also reported. The inelastic scattering differential cross sections from a number of levels in C12 and in A127 have also been determined. Spins and parities for some carbon levels are suggested from tne small angle behaviour of the scattering. [...]
thesis.creator: Felvinci, John Paul.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: High-resolution study of proton scattering.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The flow of fibre suspensions has interested many workers, both from a theoretical and practical viewpoint. Pulp flow in a paper mill, transportation of coal in oil, and wheat in water are examples of the importance of two-phase flow in which solids are suspended in liquids. Since new applications of solid-liquid flow will also continue to occur, a basic understanding of the flow properties of suspensions is important. [...]
thesis.creator: Fels Morton.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: Turbulent velocity profiles of model fibre suspensions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: L'oeuvre de Jean-Jacques Rousseau révèle une assez grande variété de forme, de ton, et d'intérêt. Pour cette raison on peut toujours y trouver du nouveau, ce qui explique l'abondance d'interprétations et de réinterprétations que cette oeuvre a suscitée depuis deux siècles. J'avais commencé ma propre étude de Rousseau avec un sujet un peu différent en tête; je songeais à traiter le thème de la promenade chez Rousseau, sujet déjà étudié en détail par maints critiques, et qui se rapporte surtout à la vie de Jean-Jacques. [...]
thesis.creator: Fefferman, Joyce Ann.
thesis.subject: Rousseau, Jean-Jacques, 1712-1778.
French.
thesis.title: Les voyages des personnages imaginaires dans l’oeuvre de J.-J. Rousseau.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.discipline: Department of French Language and Literature

thesis.description: The Cuban Crisis of October 22-28, 1962, pitted against each other the two world giants who have weapons that can destroy each other and at the same time all of human society. The suspenseful events of that week brought the world to the brink of World War III. As the crisis receded upon agreement of the Soviet Union to remove the offensive missiles from Cuba and by the States to refrain, under certain conditions, from invading Cuba, so did the memory of that week. [...]
thesis.creator: Fedele, Frank.
thesis.subject: Sovereignty.
Aerial observation (Military science).
Airspace (International law).
Air & Space Law.
thesis.title: Peacetime reconnaissance from air space and outer space : a study of defensive rights in contemporary international law.

degree.discipline: Institute of Air and Space Law

thesis.description: Zinc is one of the major non-ferrous metals required by industry. Its largest application is in the galvanizing of iron and steel products. A substantial tonnage is also used in the making of brass and in the form of alloys for pressure die-casting. Zinc can be fabricated by almost all of the processes used in metal forming: it can be rolled, extruded, drawn, spun and bent as well as cast. Wrought zinc and zinc alloys have the special anti-corrosion properties that are necessary for many types of service, e.g., in roofing and in sacrificial cathodic protection. [...]
thesis.creator: Farge, Jean Claude Tabernacle.
thesis.subject: Metallurgical Engineering.
thesis.title: Recrystallization of zinc alloys.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: From its beginnings, and by its very nature, civil aviation has been interrelated with fundamental issues of national concern and with international relations of States in general. Hence, a study of the evolution of Germany's international civil aviation policies presupposes a thorough understanding of the basic interests nations have in the operations of international airlines. [...]
thesis.creator: Faller, Edmund Wilhelm.
thesis.subject: Air & Space Law.
thesis.title: Germany and international civil aviation : a policy-oriented historical study.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This research report attempts to investigate the significance of the relationship between the use of waiting periods with applicants prior to treatment and the withdrawal of the application for treatment. This area of inquiry will be explored through a study of a sample group of families, who applied for service at a Psychiatric Department and who did not return for treatment after a waiting period. The fact that a large proportion of clients who are put on a waiting list do not return for treatment, was of concern to the researchers because it was not known what happened to these clients. The writers' interest in the topic was intensified during their field work experience. [...]
thesis.creator: Engelberg, Rosanne.
Greenberg, Eryna.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: A follow-up study of waiting list drop-outs: a study of sixteen applicants who did not return for treatment to the Psychiatric Department of the Montreal Children's Hospital.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: L'emploi de substances'herbicides pour le désherbage chimique des cultures connaît depuis quelque 15 ans une montée fantastique qui représente un aspect intéressant pour l'économie agricole. Chaque année, un grand nombre de composés sont le sujet d'études intensives en vue de leur emploi possible comme herbicides. Il y a environ 3 ans, un dérivé de l'urée, le linuron, a été mis à la disposition des chercheurs intéressés aux problèmes du désherbage chimique des cultures. Les résultats ont été des plus satisfaisants, du fait que ce composé offrait de grandes possibilités en traitement de préémergence. [...]
thesis.creator: Emond, Gilles.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: Mode d'action de la substance herbicide 3-(3,4-dichloro-phényl)-1-méthoxy-1-méthlurée (linuron) utilisée en traitement de préémergence.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Evidence to show that rusted wheat can fix elementary nitrogen was reported by d'Oliveira in 1939. If this be true the infection of this host by this parasite would have the rare property of fixing nitrogen in common with mycorrhiza, leguminous plants infected with root nodule bacteria and the few other possible associations. The fact that there is a short initial mutualistic symbiosis between rust and wheat makes this possibility of nitrogen fixation by the rusted wheat not entirely unlikely. However, d'0liveira's studies were admittedly preliminary ones, in which he used the Kjeldahl method of nitrogen analysis. [...]
thesis.creator: Ellis, C. R.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
Nitrogen -- Fixation.
Wheat rusts.
thesis.title: The effect of Puccinia Graminis pers. F. SP. Tritici Erikss. and E. Henn. infection on the nitrogen nutrition of seedlings of Triticum Compactum L. Var. Little Club.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Factors responsible for variable results in small chamber fumigation tests were studied to develop a reliable and sensitive method for detecting susceptibility differences between insect strains. Quart Mason jars; weighed fumigant-filled glass capillary tubes; absorbent paper; and screen cages attached under jar lids and charged with insects through readily sealed openings constituted the apparatus selected. At room temperature a two-hour evaporation period, five-hour exposure period and 14- to 20-day post-exposure period proved best. The effects of day-to-day variability were minimized by testing each material along with a standard and making comparisons based on susceptibility indices. [...]
thesis.creator: Ellis, Clifford Roy.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: Small chamber testing of insecticidal fumigants.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the presence of a static magnetic field, the energy levels associated with the magnetic moments of paramagnetic ions in a crystal lattice are determined primarily by their interaction with the static magnetic field and the crystalline electric field. In addition, the energy levels are perturbed slightly by dipolar interactions among the magnetic moments themselves. Magnetic resonance is concerned with transitions between these energy levels. In the usual spin magnetic resonance experiment, a small alternating magnetic field is applied in addition to the static magnetic field mentioned previously. [...]
thesis.creator: Dyment, John Cameron.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Spectral diffusion of the chromium ion.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Germane (GeH4), the germanium analog of methane, was first prepared by Voegelen (1) in 1902 by the action of zinc and sulphuric acid on germanium tetrachloride. No further work on the hydrides of germanium was done until 1922 when Muller and Smith (2) studied the preparation of germane with a view to using the hydride in a reaction, similar to the Marsh test, for the detection of minute quantities of germanium. That same year, Paneth and Schmidt-Hebbel (3) produced germane by the reaction of sulphuric acid with a mixture of zinc, magnesium and germanium, and Schenck. (4) obtained germane from the action of acid on magnesium germanide. [...]
thesis.creator: Dutton, Walter Arthur.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Preparation and properties of methylgermylsilanes and some related compounds.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Utilizing non-metabolizable substrates as valuable tools to differentiate between transport and subsequent metabolism, the possibility was explored whether there was a relationship between the sodium requirement by marine bacterial cella for growth and a sodium requirement for uptake of substrates. Various aspects of the transport phenomenen in these organisms were studied and the following findings are claimed to constitute a contribution to knowledge. [...]
thesis.creator: Drapeau, Gabriel Rosaire.
thesis.subject: Sodium -- Physiological effect.
Microbiology.
Marine bacteria.
thesis.title: The function of sodium in marine bacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The modern world is one in which there is rapid change, but as far as people in the human professions are concerned, the real meaning of this change is "the effect it has upon people...people must change, must acquire an accustomed facility for change if they are to live in the modern world." Because social change has come to be seen as a necessary adjunct of continuing scientific and technological change, the emphasis of the social work profession is shifting from therepeutic to preventative. In order to make change most positive, the effects should be anticipated and planned for. [...]
thesis.creator: Downie, Pearl T. H.
Ho, James K. S.
Purves-Smith, William R.
Horsham, Daphne E.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Physical change and style of life.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Reference to published research in Agricultural Economics will quickly show a distinct pattern of subject emphasis over time. There are perhaps several reasons why this should be so, but two can be cited as generally important. In the first place, government policy for agriculture in any country will provide an effective stimulus to certain lines of inquiry. For instance, price supports in United States agriculture since World War II have led to studies of resource adjustment and surplus problems. [...]
thesis.creator: Dorling, Michael J.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Economics.
thesis.title: Spatial equilibrium conditions for the Canadian corn economy in the 1961-1962 crop year.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Prior to now, Iittle attention has.been given to the possible contribution toward ore formation of the vast quantities of sedimentary pore water as it is squeezed out by forces of compaction during sediment accumulation. Yet in spite of the difficulty entailed in direct study, the hypothesis of ore formation by migrating connate waters appears to involve a much simpler process of metal mobilization and concentration than many of the currently favored theories. [...]
thesis.creator: Spence, John Alan
thesis.subject: Geology
thesis.title: Possible ore forming fluids from sedimentary accumulations
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ozone was discovered in 1840 by Charles Frederik Schonbein (1), Professer of Chemistry at the University of Basel, Switzerland, who communicated this discovery to the Basel Society for Natural History on April 8, 1840. The discovery appears in several publications during that year (2 - 5) including the British Association Reports, the latter publication being the first on the subject in English (5). [...]

thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: The effect of ozone on pulmonary function.

thesis.description: This study is designed to examine the functioning of certain aspects of the ego of the older adolescent under nonlaboratory stress-specifically, the stability of the ego identity during initiation into college fraternities. That such a study might contribute to our understanding of the identity of the older adolescent has been suggested by Slocombe (61) and by Erikson, the latter stating (17, p. 144): [...]
thesis.creator: Unwin, John R.
thesis.subject: Identity
Stress-initiation
thesis.title: Stability of identity in the ollder adolescent under stress-initiation into college fraternities.
